file_content.text: I--I can't believe it. Yuon was near death, but you saved her. Incredible.
You're Yuon's last hope.
Oh, you're here! Quickly--we're barely detecting a pulse on Yuon.
If there was any time to test what you learned in the temple, it's now.
The Masters taught me well.
Have faith, Attros.
Yuon's life is in your hands now.
I hope this works.
Quite the test....
So do I. Yuon's life depends on it.
Be quiet and let me concentrate.
Shush!
Oh. I'm sorry--go ahead.
Are you any closer to finding the last Noetikon?
I've found it, and the Masters have told me how to find a cure. It's in the ruins of the Jedi Temple.
I'm close to a cure.
A cure! At last.
I'm on my way to the Jedi Temple now to find a cure.
The temple has the answer.
The temple? So the Noetikons were able to point you to something useful--wonderful.
I may have figured something out, but I have to get to the Jedi Temple first.
Possibly.
A--all right. I'm glad you're close.
Just be warned--the ruins of the temple are crawling with danger. And getting there means passing through the Works; they're not safe either.
Be careful, but hurry--I don't know how long Yuon will last.
I need to talk to you. I have... bad news.
Yuon's illness has begun to affect her body. She's losing strength, fading fast.
Lars Baddeg is a dangerous man. Please, watch your back.
The Justicars are self-appointed lawmen that police the lower city. Republic security was stretched thin after the attack, so the Justicars took over.
Lars Baddeg is one of their leaders, near the top of the Republic's wanted list.
Like it or not, I have reason to believe the last Noetikon is in Justicar territory.
I must go, regardless.
I'll take my chances.
Thanks for the warning.
Lars Baddeg is known to hole up in the central tower area. Do be careful. I'll take care of Yuon while you're gone.
That must have been awful. To fight your own Master....
That may not have been necessary, but better safe than sorry right now.
I don't know what came over her. One minute she was placid, and then....
Is fight for life. Call for help.
It's more imperative than ever that we find the Noetikons. Do you have any leads on the third?
Both the Gand and a Black Sun member mentioned Lars Baddeg, a Justicar. I think he's connected.
It's more imperative than ever that we find a cure. What have you learned?
I need the Noetikon of Secrets. And both the Gand and Black Sun gave me a name: a Justicar called Lars Baddeg.
Yuon, you have to stop!
Please, Yuon. Calm down. Nobody here wants to hurt you.
Ah, yes, Attros, but the darkness is coming. Maybe I want to hurt you?
Yes, I think I'd like to break all your bones. I'd enjoy hearing them go pop, pop, pop.
What are you doing?
Master Yuon?
It's nothing. I'm just playing with little Attros here.
You don't want to hurt anyone. Fight it.
This isn't you, Master.
Fight? I don't know what you're talking about.
What's a few broken bones between friends? Want to play?
I don't want to have to fight you, but you need to step away from Attros and calm down.
I want you to take it easy.
Look, Attros! She wants to play!
Peace, Yuon! Is no prey here for you.
What game shall we play, Attros? Shall we cut out her ears first or her eyes?
Look, Attros! He wants to play!
Peace, Yuon! Is no prey here for you.
What game shall we play, Attros? Shall we cut out his ears first or his eyes?
Just calm down, please.
Don't do this, Yuon.
Calm down? But we're having so much fun!
But I do think it's time you played along!
I'm running out of patience.
Don't push me.
Neither.
Please, Yuon, it's me. Your Padawan.
Don't you recognize me?
My Padawan? I don't have a Padawan. I sent her to fight the Flesh Raiders, and before the day was done, they dined.
My Padawan? I don't have a Padawan. I sent him to fight the Flesh Raiders, and before the day was done, they dined.
I defeated the Flesh Raiders, Yuon. I'm alive.
No, they didn't.
You? No... it can't be. Rip out her throat! Tear her apart!
You? No... it can't be. Rip out his throat! Tear him apart!
No! Padawan! No--please. Help me. I can't stop it. It's him again. Help me....
Yuon!
It's okay. I'm here to help you.
Don't worry, Yuon.
Help? Ha! I don't need your help. I don't need anyone's help!
Now's your chance, Attros.
Restrain her.
There... she's restrained.
Phew. That's more excitement than I care for.
I hate to have to do this.
I'm sorry. [Knock her out]
You're a Jedi Master. Act as one.
Snap out of it!
Qyzen, your friend--he was there on Tython, too. He hunted those Flesh Raiders.
Do you remember Qyzen?
Is so, Yuon. Herald lives, and I.
Qyzen? Oh no, no. They devoured him, too. Let me show you how!
You're hurting people. Calm down or I'll have to stop you.
This isn't a game.
Oh, now that's not very nice, is it?
We're going to have to teach this one a lesson, aren't we, Attros?
Forgive me, Yuon, but I'm not letting you injure anyone else.
Sorry. I'm stopping this now.
Spoiling my fun? That won't do at all.
Yuon has taken a turn for the worse. She attacked my assistant Pharen.
Yuon is true hunter. Will fight to live.
I've managed to keep her restrained, but I'm worried what will happen if she doesn't calm down.
Perhaps Yuon will quiet down if I talk to her.
I should be there.
Yes, I was thinking that myself. Come as quick as you can.
I can't imagine Yuon raising a hand to anybody.
Yuon attacked someone?
I know, but she just lashed out at Pharen. Please, we need you back here.
I'm on my way.
Thank you. Please hurry.
Yuon--calm down, please. There's no man in the shadows here--
Ah, there you are! The Noetikons... how is the search going?
Two of the Noetikons gave me advice. When l find the third, we might have a cure.
We're making progress.
I'm glad to hear it. But right now, I need you back at the Embassy.
It's been hit or miss, but I've managed to find some answers.
I've had some success.
I hate to interrupt you, but I need you back at the Embassy.
I have a lot of vague wisdom, nothing I could use to help Yuon.
Nothing concrete yet.
I'm sorry to hear that, but we have a bit of an emergency on our hands.
That Black Sun warehouse is our best bet for the second Noetikon. But be careful, I sense something's wrong.
I have a solid lead on the second Noetikon. Unfortunately, it's in Black Sun territory. They're a local gang, pretty vicious.
What would street thugs do with a Jedi artifact?
A gang has a holocron?
I'm not sure. This whole situation is odd.
Yuon needs those Noetikons to help her. Tell me where to go.
I must face them, for Yuon.
They'll give me the Noetikon peacefully or face a battle, it's their choice.
I'll make them see reason.
Good, you're back! Did you find it--the first Noetikon?
I talked to the Noetikon's Masters. They had advice, but no definitive cure.
Found it, and used it.
You actually spoke to them? Amazing. At least we're on the right track.
How's my master? Is she alright?
What's Yuon's condition?
Yuon's resting right now; no more outbursts. But the Noetikons are still our best hope.
Someone had given it to the Gand to keep from us.
Not without some trouble.
Really? That might explain a few things....
We think the first Noetikon is in the Migrant Merchants' Guild--speak to Alec Efran.
I know the Black Sun has been smuggling items from the temple. I helped disrupt their work.
They sell Jedi artifacts.
I heard, but this seems to be a separate operation.
Large shipments are going into a Black Sun warehouse, but never coming out again. My sources say the Noetikon was among those shipments.
This is the warehouse's location. Go carefully: the Black Sun are up to something, I can feel it.
My sister works at the Silent Sun cantina. She says the Black Sun has turned the cantina's back rooms into some secret warehouse.
There's shipments going in--my sister saw the Noetikon in one of them. But no shipments are going out again.
An interesting puzzle.
Thank you, Pharen.
Where is this cantina?
I'll give you directions to the Silent Sun cantina; please, be careful. Those Black Sun gangsters are vicious.
